caption:
There is no one quite like Dwayne 'The Rock' Johnson. Director Jake Kasdan says Johnson is maybe the most difficult person to recast in Hollywood. If he says no, or needs to be replaced, there is no second option.

This isn't accidental. Behind the blockbuster success, Johnson has carefully crafted strategy that made him truly irreplaceable: "I had this conceit and I idealized what my career should be. The conceit was: Audience first. Let's take care of the audience first. So I get a piece of material, I'd look at it and think, Okay, does this have four-quadrant capability and opportunity? Are audiences going to like seeing me in this role?"

In our #GQMOTY cover story, Johnson opens up his upcoming films Red One and Moana 2, the method behind his meteoric rise, and why the A24 film The Smashing Machine represents his boldest reinvention yet. Read and watch more at the link in bio.

Written by @zachbaron
